Cell phones are portable telephones that use cellular networks to transmit signals.

A mobile phone, cell phone, cellphone, or hand phone, sometimes shortened to simply mobile, cell or just phone, is a portable telephone that can make and receive calls over a radio frequency link while the user is moving within a telephone service area.
Electronic waste or e-waste describes discarded electrical or electronic devices.
A cell phone is a portable telephone that can make and receive calls over a radio frequency carrier while the user is moving within a telephone service area.

Electronic waste or e-waste describes discarded electrical or electronic devices. Used electronics which are destined for reuse, resale, salvage, recycling, or disposal are also considered e-waste. Informal processing of e-waste in developing countries can lead to adverse human health effects and environmental pollution.
